p: NP is the most abundant protein in the RNP complex, NP monomers are linked together by insertion the tail-loop of one NP protomer to its neighbouring molecule. NP oligomerization provides a RNA-binding surface for vRNA and complementary RNA (cRNA) [ 1, 12, 13]. Previous studies show that NP interacts with all three polymerase subunits [ 14– 17]. Earlier studies suggested that NP served as a switch between transcription and replication [ 17– 19], which was challenged by a more recent evidence showing that NP is recruited as an elongation factor during vRNA and cRNA synthesis but not as a switch [ 20].
